``` New template: ``` @if (currentRoot) {

Issues.Title: control-flow migration produced template that doesn't compile
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Old template:

```
    <app-foo *ngFor="let stepData of stepList; trackBy:trackByFn let index = index">
        ...
    </app-foo>
```

Migrated template:

```
@for (stepData of stepList; track trackByFn let index = index(trackBy:trackByFn  index, stepData); let trackBy:trackByFn  index = $index) {
  <app-foo>
     ...
  </app-foo>
}
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

error  Parsing error: Parser Error: Unexpected token 'let' at column 11 in [trackByFn let index = index(trackBy:trackByFn  index, stepData)] in [...]/1_inline-template-step-list.component.ts-1.component.html@1:32
```

Issues.Title: Resource: value.set() fails after resource goes in error state
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

common, core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Using a resource as described in
https://angular.dev/guide/signals/resource#reactive-data-fetching-with-httpresource

**Expectation**
It is possible to overwrite the resource value manually.

**Actual Behavior**
After the resource entered error state value.set() fails. It is also not possible to manually clear the error state unless doing a reload.

Example:
see the stackblitz attached

How to reproduce
1. wait for the stackblitz to load
2. now there are two resources, one simulating a successful api call, another one a failing api call
3. now click the button to set the values
4. value of resource A is now set and state changed to local, but value of resource B is not set, instead there is an exception claiming Resource is currently in an error state

**Notes**

I am not sure if this is an actual issue or just a documentation issue, but the fact that there is a "local" state and it works before the resource enters error state indicates to me that it is indeed an intended use case for resources to be overridden manually, but there is just documentation or functionality lacking to clear the error state.

The same code worked with angular 19.


### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-fmd8ihf4?file=src%2Fmain.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
.webcontainer@runtime.b980e309.js:26 ERROR ResourceValueError: Resource is currently in an error state (see Error.cause for details): oh no!
    at ResourceImpl.computed.equal.equal [as computation] (resource-BPCh38bN.mjs:383:27)
    at Object.producerRecomputeValue (signal-ePSl6jXn.mjs:411:33)
    at producerUpdateValueVersion (signal-ePSl6jXn.mjs:139:10)
    at ResourceImpl.computed2 [as value] (signal-ePSl6jXn.mjs:351:9)
    at App_Template (main.ts:26:5)
    at executeTemplate (debug_node-Dn-GvQJo.mjs:7142:9)
    at refreshView (debug_node-Dn-GvQJo.mjs:8887:13)
    at detectChangesInView (debug_node-Dn-GvQJo.mjs:9107:9)
    at detectChangesInViewIfAttached (debug_node-Dn-GvQJo.mjs:9067:5)
    at detectChangesInComponent (debug_node-Dn-GvQJo.mjs:9055:5)Caused by: Error: oh no!
    at main.ts:7:11
    at new ZoneAwarePromise (zone.js:2702:25)
    at main.ts:6:10
    at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
    at main.js:41:61
    at new ZoneAwarePromise (zone.js:2702:25)
    at __async (main.js:25:10)
    at mockApiCallFailing (main.ts:5:34)
    at Object.loader (main.ts:35:42)
    at resource-BPCh38bN.mjs:576:50
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

Issues.Title: Bad lighthouse LCP and FCP even with incremental hydration
Issues.Body:
Not really angulars fault. Incremental hydration and event replay are amazing. But wanted to made you aware, as lighthouse is also google and lighthouse score is used for search rankings? So this affects angular apps.

There is already an issue at lighthouse which explains it nicely: https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse/issues/16539

Reproduction:
download lighthouse (12.6.1) and measure your own documentation which uses SSR:

```
npm i -g lighthouse
lighthouse https://angular.dev/
```

This is the result:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/42f9a88c-29e3-470d-b706-084e3937953e)

IMO it should be 90+ ... and as https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse/issues/16539 describes it, the bad LCP and FCP numbers are explained due to lighthouse adding all requests to them as "Render delay", even though SSR already was visually complete.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bad lighthouse LCP and FCP even with incremental hydration" (#62240)

Issues.Title: refactor(common): move `ngServerMode` check outside `tap()` to enable tree-shaking
Issues.Body:
In this commit, the `ngServerMode` check is moved outside the RxJS `pipe()` to ensure that server-only logic is excluded from client bundles. Previously, the `tap()` operator and its closure were always included in the output, even though `ngServerMode` was false on the client and the side effect was never triggered.

By guarding the observable chain earlier, this reduces the RxJS stack frame depth, which simplifies debugging by avoiding unnecessary operator noise in client-side stack traces.

The resulting logic is also easier to reason about and avoids evaluating `HttpResponse` instances where not needed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(common): move `ngServerMode` check outside `tap()` to enable tree-shaking" (#62238)

Issues.Title: Show the transfer state in the devtools
Issues.Body:
### Is this a bug report or a feature request?

- [x] Feature Request

### Description [Feature Request only]

When using SSR, debugging transfer state is a bit of a pain as we have to open ChromeDevtools, go to elements tab, find the ng-state script, copy the content, paste it in some code formatter to better understand it. 

### Proposed solution [Feature Request only]

Devtools can either show transfer state in some table in some new devtools tab. 
Or just add a button somewhere in the devtools which will just console.log the transfer state.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Show the transfer state in the devtools" (#62237)

Issues.Title: Track Signal values by toggling their tracking in the devtools
Issues.Body:
### Is this a bug report or a feature request?

- [x] Feature Request

### Description [Feature Request only]

I want to be able to click toggle a button in the devtools near any signal field, and at that moment, the signal should start logging the value in the console everytime it changes. This way, I can easily debug signal changes, without having to create an effect myself everytime I have to  track/debug signal changes. 

### Alternatives considered [Feature Request only]

Create an effect to debug the signals I need to track.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Track Signal values by toggling their tracking in the devtools" (#62236)

Issues.Title: Add buttons to console.log component instance and component fields in the devtools
Issues.Body:
### Is this a bug report or a feature request?

- [ ] Bug Report
- [x] Feature Request


### Description [Feature Request only]

I want to inspect the component class instance, and sometimes the class fields. 
- Having the possibility to log it in the console makes it easier to navigate the component class instance. 
- Having the possibility to log a specific field in the console would be great too.

On of the reasons this is needed is to understand for example the type of some values (if they are string or number), because currently when inspecting the state from the devtools we just can see the value, but not if its a string or number. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b570d1d4-b585-495f-a355-f84e9ca845e2)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add buttons to console.log component instance and component fields in the devtools" (#62235)

Issues.Title: Inject function migration of overridden services
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

The migration to the inject function doesn't handle overridden services correctly.

```ts
@Inject(FileService) private fileService: ExtendedFileService
```

becomes

```ts
private fileService = inject<ExtendedFileService>(FileService);
```

But FileService is not a subclass or implementation of ExtendedFileService, but an extension, so Angular (and TypeScript) complain.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/mqmcbmkx?file=src%2Fmain.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
âœ˜ [ERROR] TS2345: Argument of type 'typeof FileService' is not assignable to parameter of type 'ProviderToken<ExtendedFileService>'.
  Type 'typeof FileService' is not assignable to type 'Type<ExtendedFileService>'.
    Property 'prefix' is missing in type 'FileService' but required in type 'ExtendedFileService'. [plugin angular-compiler]

    src/main.ts:28:54:
      28 â”‚   protected readonly fs = inject<ExtendedFileService>(FileService);
         â•µ                                                       ~~~~~~~~~~~
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true

```

### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Inject function migration of overridden services" (#62232)

Issues.Title: @angular/core: Publish fesm2022 files without changing hash
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? core ### Description In Angular 20 versions, file names in fesm2022 folder have changing has in them. In Angular 19 this was not the case. Well, in fact, Angular 19 bundled all code to just `core.mjs` and Angular 20 has it split to multiple files. (see [npm code tab](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@angular/core?activeTab=code)) This makes it really hard to patch code in those files, since the file name will be changing with every release. This patching is needed in our project, because we need to allow "style" httml attribute in sanitizer. (ref. https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/45270)
Example patch to allow style attribute and legend html block

```diff diff --git a/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/debug_node-DTOmNMDH.mjs b/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/debug_node-DTOmNMDH.mjs index 3eca558..a3b3cfa 100755 --- a/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/debug_node-DTOmNMDH.mjs +++ b/node_modules/@angular/core/fesm2022/debug_node-DTOmNMDH.mjs @@ -5246,7 +5246,7 @@ const OPTIONAL_END_TAG_ELEMENTS = merge(OPTIONAL_END_TAG_INLINE_ELEMENTS, OPTION // Safe Block Elements - HTML5 const BLOCK_ELEMENTS = merge(OPTIONAL_END_TAG_BLOCK_ELEMENTS, tagSet('address,article,' + 'aside,blockquote,caption,center,del,details,dialog,dir,div,dl,figure,figcaption,footer,h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,' + - 'h6,header,hgroup,hr,ins,main,map,menu,nav,ol,pre,section,summary,table,ul')); + 'h6,header,hgroup,hr,ins,legend,main,map,menu,nav,ol,pre,section,summary,table,ul')); // Inline Elements - HTML5 const INLINE_ELEMENTS = merge(OPTIONAL_END_TAG_INLINE_ELEMENTS, tagSet('a,abbr,acronym,audio,b,' + 'bdi,bdo,big,br,cite,code,del,dfn,em,font,i,img,ins,kbd,label,map,mark,picture,q,ruby,rp,rt,s,' + @@ -5257,7 +5257,7 @@ const URI_ATTRS = tagSet('background,cite,href,itemtype,longdesc,poster,src,xlin const HTML_ATTRS = tagSet('abbr,accesskey,align,alt,autoplay,axis,bgcolor,border,cellpadding,cellspacing,class,clear,color,cols,colspan,' + 'compact,controls,coords,datetime,default,dir,download,face,headers,height,hidden,hreflang,hspace,' + 'ismap,itemscope,itemprop,kind,label,lang,language,loop,media,muted,nohref,nowrap,open,preload,rel,rev,role,rows,rowspan,rules,' + - 'scope,scrolling,shape,size,sizes,span,srclang,srcset,start,summary,tabindex,target,title,translate,type,usemap,' + + 'scope,scrolling,shape,size,sizes,span,srclang,srcset,start,style,summary,tabindex,target,title,translate,type,usemap,' + 'valign,value,vspace,width'); // Accessibility attributes as per WAI-ARIA 1.1 (W3C Working Draft 14 December 2018) const ARIA_ATTRS = tagSet('aria-activedescendant,aria-atomic,aria-autocomplete,aria-busy,aria-checked,aria-colcount,aria-colindex,' + ```

### Proposed solution Bundle all `core.mjs` code to one file like it was before, or try to bundle it without changing file names. ### Alternatives considered Allow "style" in sanitizer (#45270)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular/core: Publish fesm2022 files without changing hash" (#62228)

Issues.Title: [unit-test] `karma` runner doesn't support `zone.js/testing` auto injection
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

The experimental `@angular/build:unit-test` injects `zone.js/testing` into the `polyfills` of builder option but only for Vitest. In use `runner: 'karma'`, there are no way to load `zone.js/testing` for the environment.

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/packages/angular/build/src/builders/unit-test/builder.ts#L114-L116

I think this lines should be moved to the before branching runners. (`if(runnerName === 'karma')`)

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/packages/angular/build/src/builders/unit-test/builder.ts#L61-L66

### Minimal Reproduction

- Use `unit-test` builder for `ng test`
- Use `fakeAsync` in tests
- Run `ng test`

### Exception or Error

```text
Error: zone-testing.js is needed for the fakeAsync() test helper but could not be found.
          Please make sure that your environment includes zone.js/testing
      at fakeAsync
```

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 20.0.3
Node: 22.16.0
Package Manager: pnpm 10.12.1
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 20.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, elements
... forms, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.2000.3
@angular-devkit/core         20.0.3
@angular-devkit/schematics   20.0.3
@angular/build               20.0.3
@angular/cdk                 20.0.3
@angular/cli                 20.0.3
@schematics/angular          20.0.3
rxjs                         7.8.2
typescript                   5.8.3
zone.js                      0.15.1
```

### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[unit-test] `karma` runner doesn't support `zone.js/testing` auto injection" (#30595)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): partial custom postcss config support
Issues.Body: The `browser` builder now supports providing a custom postcss configuration similar to the functionality available in the `@angular/build:application` builder. A postcss configuration file named either `postcss.config.json` or `.postcssrc.json` will be discovered in order from the project root or workspace root. Only plugins can be configured via the file. All other fields will be ignored. Additionally the plugins will be placed after any internal build system plugins but before `autoprefixer`. When using a custom postcss configuration, the automatic tailwind integration will be disabled. The Tailwind postcss plugin should be added to the configuration file in this scenario.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): partial custom postcss config support" (#30592)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): add missing prettier config
Issues.Body:
The current style guide no longer enforces the use of the template file extension `.component.html`. This means that prettier won't auto-detect the proper parser for these files anymore.

To ensure template formatting works out-of-the-box, we're adding a prettier config to newly created projects.

Fixes https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/30548
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): add missing prettier config" (#30590)

Issues.Title: CLI: [command new] add option to enable previous suffix generation on create
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

compiler-cli

### Description

### The problem:

**Starting in Angular v20, by default Angular CLI will not generate suffixes**

As written in https://blog.angular.dev/announcing-angular-v20-b5c9c06cf301

>Starting in Angular v20, by default Angular CLI will not generate suffixes for your components, directives, services, and pipes. For existing projects, ng update will enable suffix generation by updating your angular.json. To enable suffix generation in new projects, use the following schematic configuration:

```
{
  "projects": {
    "app": {
      ...
      "schematics": {
        "@schematics/angular:component": { "type": "component" },
        "@schematics/angular:directive": { "type": "directive" },
        "@schematics/angular:service": { "type": "service" },
        "@schematics/angular:guard": { "typeSeparator": "." },
        "@schematics/angular:interceptor": { "typeSeparator": "." },
        "@schematics/angular:module": { "typeSeparator": "." },
        "@schematics/angular:pipe": { "typeSeparator": "." },
        "@schematics/angular:resolver": { "typeSeparator": "." }
      },
  ...
}
```



### Proposed solution

### The solution:

To add an option to the new command, to be able to create a new application with suffixes:

`ng new angular-app --with-suffix`

This command will automatically add **schematics** to the `angular.json` and creates e.g. `app.component.ts` instead off `app.ts`

### Alternatives considered

The only way to achive this, add manually the schematics and rename the auto generated files manually.
This is time consuming.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CLI: [command new] add option to enable previous suffix generation on create" (#30594)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): provide partial custom postcss configuration support
Issues.Body: The `browser` builder now supports providing a custom postcss configuration similar to the functionality available in the `@angular/build:application` builder. A postcss configuration file named either `postcss.config.json` or `.postcssrc.json` will be discovered in order from the project root or workspace root. Only plugins can be configured via the file. All other fields will be ignored. Additionally the plugins will be placed after any internal build system plugins but before `autoprefixer`. When using a custom postcss configuration, the automatic tailwind integration will be disabled. The Tailwind postcss plugin should be added to the configuration file in this scenario.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): provide partial custom postcss configuration support" (#30591)

Issues.Title: SSR REQUEST token no longer holds the referer header
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "SSR REQUEST token no longer holds the referer header" (#30581)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/ssr): ensure correct referer header handling in web request conversion
Issues.Body:
The `Referer` header is classified as a forbidden header name within the Web Standard Fetch API. This means it cannot be manually set directly within the `headers` option, instead it must be set when constructing a `new Request()` object.

Closes #30581
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/ssr): ensure correct referer header handling in web request conversion" (#30583)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): adjust coverage includes/excludes for unit-test vitest runner
Issues.Body:
The experimental `unit-test` builder with `vitest` support will now explicitly include the tested files instead of using the default of all files within the workspace. This prevents a potentially long wait time to calculate coverage. The excludes have also been adjusted to ensure that application code bundled into the intermediate test output is also counted within the coverage reports.

Closes #30557
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/build): adjust coverage includes/excludes for unit-test vitest runner" (#30582)

Issues.Title: Error in PostCSS + tailwind doesn't break the build
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

With postcss + tailwind, when I have an error in a css file, it displays a big red error in the logs, but the build continue and is done successfuly.

### Minimal Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

- create a new angular project with default options.
- npm install tailwindcss @tailwindcss/postcss postcss --force
- create the .postcssrc.json with 
```
{
  "plugins": {
    "@tailwindcss/postcss": {}
  }
}
```
- add the follwing in the css of a component `@reference "not-found.css";`
- npm run build

The error is displayed but the build continue and is successful.

Issues.Title: New Angular projects install jasmine-core ~5.7.0 but use 4.6.1
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

The package.json file generated by `ng new` includes the dev dependency `"jasmine-core": "~5.7.0"`, but jasmine-core 4.6.1 is also installed and used to run tests in Karma.
Steps to reproduce:

1. Install @angular/cli 20.0.3.
2. Run `ng new some-name` and accept all the defaults.
3. Note the jasmine-core dependency in package.json.
4. Run `npm test` and note the Jasmine version displayed in the browser.
5. Run `npm ls jasmine-core`.

Expected: The versions from steps 3 and 4 agree, and step 5 shows that only a single version of jasmine-core is installed.
Observed: Step 3 and 4 show different major versions, and step 5 shows that two different versions of jasmine-core are installed.

The problem is that karma-jasmine declares a dependency on jasmine-core 4.x. `ng new` tries to set up the project to use jasmine-core 5.x, but it doesn't add [the necessary override](https://jasmine.github.io/pages/faq.html#001-karma).

Note: I'm not an Angular user, but I do maintain Jasmine. I've seen this version mismatch cause a couple of problems. One is that Angular users are occasionally confused about which major version of jasmine-core they're actually using. The other is that it makes jasmine-core download statistics pretty much useless for determining uptake of the latest major version, since an unknown but probably large portion of 5.x downloads are from Angular users who are actually still running 4.x.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true

```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 20.0.3
Node: 20.19.0
Package Manager: npm 10.8.2
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 20.0.4
... common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, router

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.2000.3
@angular-devkit/core         20.0.3
@angular-devkit/schematics   20.0.3
@angular/build               20.0.3
@angular/cli                 20.0.3
@schematics/angular          20.0.3
rxjs                         7.8.2
typescript                   5.8.3
zone.js                      0.15.1
```

### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "New Angular projects install jasmine-core ~5.7.0 but use 4.6.1" (#30575)

Issues.Title: CLI does not generate suffix for components by default
Issues.Body:
### Command

generate

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

19.1.0

### Description

When I try to generate a new component, files are expected to have a suffix `.component` and class name expected to have a suffix `Component`.

However in version 20.0.3, these suffixes are not generated by default:
```
> ng g c login
CREATE src/app/login/login.spec.ts (544 bytes)
CREATE src/app/login/login.ts (193 bytes)
CREATE src/app/login/login.scss (0 bytes)
CREATE src/app/login/login.html (21 bytes)
```

This also applies to services. I haven't tried other sub-commands.

I use Windows 11 and Powershell 7.

### Minimal Reproduction

```
ng new test
cd test
ng g c login
```

### Exception or Error

### Your Environment

```text
20.0.3
```

### Anything else relevant?

As a workaround, using the `--type component` option when generating the components is working.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CLI does not generate suffix for components by default" (#30566)

test

```cli
/Users/jlanssie/.nvm/versions/node/v22.13.1/bin/node /private/var/repos/personal/angular-app/node_modules/@angular/cli/bin/ng test angular-app --karma-config /Applications/IntelliJ IDEA.app/Contents/plugins/karma/js_reporter/karma-intellij/lib/intellij.conf.js --source-map

Issues.Title: Build options stylePreprocessorOptions->sass->silenceDeprecations no longer working after upgrade to Angular 20.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

```
                        "stylePreprocessorOptions": {
                            "sass": {
                                "silenceDeprecations": [
                                    "mixed-decls",
                                    "color-functions",
                                    "global-builtin",
                                    "import"
                                ]
                            }
                        },
```

None of that works anymore - warnings all over the place. Can't resolve any of this until bootstrap 6, so these need silenced.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Global built-in functions are deprecated and will be removed in Dart Sass 3.0.0.
Sass @import rules are deprecated and will be removed in Dart Sass 3.0.0.
etc.
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 20.0.3
Node: 22.16.0
Package Manager: npm 11.4.1
OS: linux x64

Angular: 20.0.4
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... platform-server, router

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.2000.3
@angular-devkit/core         20.0.3
@angular-devkit/schematics   20.0.3
@angular/build               20.0.3
@angular/cdk                 20.0.3
@angular/cli                 20.0.3
@angular/youtube-player      20.0.3
@schematics/angular          20.0.3
rxjs                         7.8.2
typescript                   5.8.3
zone.js                      0.15.0
```

### Anything else?

Appears that the new builder ignores these options.
Nothing related appears on the Update Guide.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build options stylePreprocessorOptions->sass->silenceDeprecations no longer working after upgrade to Angular 20." (#30567)

Issues.Title: feat(menu): add more tests for MatMenu component
Issues.Body:
Adds test coverage for:
- ARIA attribute inputs (aria-label, aria-labelledby, aria-describedby)
- Keyboard navigation with dynamically added/removed items
- `hasBackdrop` input property, including null/undefined cases
- Complex 3-level nested sub-menus (mouse & keyboard interactions)
- `overlapTrigger` with various x/y position combinations
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(menu): add more tests for MatMenu component" (#31426)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk-experimental/ui-patterns): add guardrails to selectOne for edge cases
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(cdk-experimental/ui-patterns): add guardrails to selectOne for edge cases" (#31402)

Issues.Title: refactor: align m2 and m3 token file functions by using get-tokens
Issues.Body:
Change m2 token files so that they provide a `get-tokens` functions like their m3 counterparts

Based off https://github.com/angular/components/pull/31389
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: align m2 and m3 token file functions by using get-tokens" (#31425)

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk-experimental/radio-group): rename radio to radio-group
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(cdk-experimental/radio-group): rename radio to radio-group" (#31424)

Issues.Title: refactor(cdk-experimental/tabs): add use case examples
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(cdk-experimental/tabs): add use case examples" (#31423)

Issues.Title: docs: snippet-based examples not showing after clicking away and coming back
Issues.Body:
Fixes that examples based on snippets (e.g. first example for autocomplete) weren't showing up if the user lands on the page, clicks to another tab and then comes back.

The problem was that the timing is different on the second run, because we hit the cached rather than fetching the content. These changes resolve it by switching the component's internal state to signals.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: snippet-based examples not showing after clicking away and coming back" (#31415)

Issues.Title: bug(form-field): Outlined form-field should have enough space to contain floating label
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description When using `outline` appearance for `mat-form-field`, the floating label overflows out of component itself. The `mat-form-field` component should have enough space on top to contain floating label. See below screenshot for reference: ### Reproduction StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/rxp9hmcc?file=src%2Fexample%2Fform-field-appearance-example.html ### Expected Behavior The `mat-form-field` component should have enough space (margin) on top to contain floating label. ### Actual Behavior The `mat-form-field` component does not have enough space (margin) on top to contain floating label. ### Environment - Angular: 20 - CDK/Material: 20 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(form-field): Outlined form-field should have enough space to contain floating label" (#31422)

Issues.Title: docs: correct treeNodeDef selectors
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: correct treeNodeDef selectors" (#31421)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/compare/v3.1.0...v3.1.1)

#### Security patch release

Recommended to upgrade, to not leak sensitive cookie and authentication header information to 3th party host while a redirect occurred

#### What's Changed

- core: update fetch-blob by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1371](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1371)
- docs: Fix typo around sending a file by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1381](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1381)
- core: (http.request): Cast URL to string before sending it to NodeJS core by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1378](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1378)
- core: handle errors from the request body stream by [@​mdmitry01](https://redirect.github.com/mdmitry01) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1392](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1392)
- core: Better handle wrong redirect header in a response by [@​tasinet](https://redirect.github.com/tasinet) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1387](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1387)
- core: Don't use buffer to make a blob by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1402](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1402)
- docs: update readme for TS [@​types/node-fetch](https://redirect.github.com/types/node-fetch) by [@​adamellsworth](https://redirect.github.com/adamellsworth) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1405](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1405)
- core: Fix logical operator priority to disallow GET/HEAD with non-empty body by [@​maxshirshin](https://redirect.github.com/maxshirshin) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1369](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1369)
- core: Don't use global buffer by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1422](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1422)
- ci: fix main branch by [@​dnalborczyk](https://redirect.github.com/dnalborczyk) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1429](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1429)
- core: use more node: protocol imports by [@​dnalborczyk](https://redirect.github.com/dnalborczyk) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1428](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1428)
- core: Warn when using data by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1421](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1421)
- docs: Create SECURITY.md by [@​JamieSlome](https://redirect.github.com/JamieSlome) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1445](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1445)
- core: don't forward secure headers to 3th party by [@​jimmywarting](https://redirect.github.com/jimmywarting) in [https://github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1449](https://redirect.github.com/node-fetch/node-fetch/pull/1449)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>pillarjs/send (send)</summary>

### [`v1.2.0`](https://redirect.github.com/pillarjs/send/blob/HEAD/HISTORY.md#120--2025-03-27)

- deps:
  - `mime-types@^3.0.1`
  - `fresh@^2.0.0`
  - removed `destroy`
- remove `getHeaderNames()` polyfill and refactor `clearHeaders()`

\==================

- Drop support for Node.js <18.0

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): update form control immediately when chips is removed
Issues.Body:
Currently, when we removed chips, the value is updated in form control only when we blur. This fix will update the value of form control immediately when removed

Fixes #30566
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/chips): update form control immediately when chips is removed" (#31420)

See the [releases page](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/releases) for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

#### 3.29.0 - 11 Jun 2025

- Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.22.0. [#​2925](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/pull/2925)
- Bump minimum CodeQL bundle version to 2.16.6. [#​2912](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/pull/2912)

See the full [CHANGELOG.md](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/blob/v3.29.0/CHANGELOG.md) for more information.

### [`v3.28.19`](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/releases/tag/v3.28.19)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/compare/v3.28.18...v3.28.19)

### CodeQL Action Changelog

See the [releases page](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/releases) for the relevant changes to the CodeQL CLI and language packs.

#### 3.28.19 - 03 Jun 2025

- The CodeQL Action no longer includes its own copy of the extractor for the `actions` language, which is currently in public preview.
  The `actions` extractor has been included in the CodeQL CLI since v2.20.6. If your workflow has enabled the `actions` language *and* you have pinned
  your `tools:` property to a specific version of the CodeQL CLI earlier than v2.20.6, you will need to update to at least CodeQL v2.20.6 or disable
  `actions` analysis.
- Update default CodeQL bundle version to 2.21.4. [#​2910](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/pull/2910)

See the full [CHANGELOG.md](https://redirect.github.com/github/codeql-action/blob/v3.28.19/CHANGELOG.md) for more information.

### [`v8.2.1`](https://redirect.github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/releases/tag/v8.2.1): Release 8.2.1 (2025-06-10)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/compare/v8.2.0...v8.2.1)

#### What's Changed

- buildozer: Respect .bazelignore by [@​amartani](https://redirect.github.com/amartani) in [https://github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/pull/1343](https://redirect.github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/pull/1343)

<details>
<summary>firebase/firebase-tools (firebase-tools)</summary>

### [`v14.8.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.8.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.7.0...v14.8.0)

- Updated the Data Connect emulator to use pglite 0.3.x and Postgres 17, which fixes some crashes related to wire protocol inconsistencies. ([#​8679](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8679), [#​8658](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8658))
- Remove container cleanup logic in functions:delete command ([#​8771](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8771))
- Fixed an issue where the IAM enablement for GenKit monitoring would try to change an invalid service account. ([#​8756](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8756))
- Added a max instance default to function templates and comments educating users on cost controls. ([#​8772](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8772))
- Added caching to API enablement checks to reduce burn of `serviceusage.googleapis.com` quota.
- Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.7.1, which includes the following changes
  - Kotlin codegen: Add a default value for the block\_ parameter to execute() so that it is not necessary to specify empty {} for operations with optional variables and none are specified.
  - Web SDK READMEs will link to other web framework READMEs for better discoverability.

### [`v14.7.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.7.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.6.0...v14.7.0)

- Add emulator support to firebase storage MCP tools. ([#​8707](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8707))
- Removed overeager error catch in `functions:list`.
- Add validation during `firebase init` feature selection. ([#​5232](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5232))
- Fixed an issue where the extensions emulator did not work with `demo-` projects. ([#​8720](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8720))
- Fixed issue where `--export-on-exit` fails if the target directory does not exist. ([#​4688](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/4688))
- Fixed issue where the Firebase MCP server could not use application default credentials. ([#​8671](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8671))
- Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.7.0, which includes the following changes: ([#​8743](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8743))
  - Fixed an issue where unwanted link dependencies are added to `package.json` when multiple package managers are used in a web project.
  - Added linter warnings for naming convention violations & missing join table `@table(key)`.

### [`v14.6.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.6.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.5.1...v14.6.0)

- Fixed issue where `projects:create` didn't correctly parse the `projectId` and `displayName` input. ([#​8634](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8634))
- Improved GetDatabase API call caching for Firestore function deployments. ([#​8681](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8681))
- Increased timeout for linking CloudSQL instances to Data Connect.
- Fixed issue where `firebase use --add` didn't correctly set the active project. ([#​8694](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8694))
- Correctly support '--database' flag in `firestore:delete`. ([#​6753](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/6753))
- Always setup Data Connect SDK when FDC\_CONNECTOR env var is set.
- `firebase init` now uses FIREBASE\_PROJECT env var as the default project name.
- Add emulator support to firestore MCP tools. ([#​8700](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8700))
- Increased npm timeout for web frameworks to 60s. ([#​8702](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8702))
- Fallback to reading web framework dependencies version directly from node\_modules package.json when the npm timeout is reached. ([#​8702](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8702))
- Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.6.3, which includes some cleanups and error message improvements. ([#​8667](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8667))

### [`v14.5.1`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.5.1)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.5.0...v14.5.1)

- Fixed an issue where 'firestore.database' was accidentally treated as a required field. ([#​8678](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8678))

### [`v14.5.0`](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v14.5.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v14.4.0...v14.5.0)

- WARNING - This version accidentally included a breaking change where `firestore.database` was treated as a required field in firebase.json. This is addressed in 14.5.1.
- Improve log messages on skipped App Hosting source deploys. ([#​8674](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8674))
- Fixed issue in `init` where users were forced to specify emulator UI port ([#​8626](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8626))
- Added MCP tools for App Hosting ([#​8605](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8605))
- Fixed crash when starting the App Hosting emulator in certain applications ([#​8624](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8624))
- Fixed issue where, with `webframeworks` enabled, `firebase init hosting` re-prompts users for source. ([#​8587](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8587))
- Updated typescript version in functions template to avoid build issue with [@​google-cloud/storage](https://redirect.github.com/google-cloud/storage) depedency ([#​8194](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8194))
- Updated the Firebase Data Connect local toolkit to v2.6.2, which includes the following changes: ([#​8667](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8667))
  - Improved error messages of `auth.uid` in CEL expressions when unauthenticated.
  - Fixed a bug where ExecuteGraphql with vector embedding in emulator fails due to missing context.
- Improved `firebase init firestore` + `firebase deploy` flow on a fresh new project without going to Console ([#​8653](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8653))
- Added support for Angular v20 to Firebase Hosting ([#​8672](https://redirect.github.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/8672))

</details>

##### Bug Fixes

- Fix blockquote code continuation ([#​3264](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3264)) ([7ab8185](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/7ab818502ed537ab8eed22dc9cf4f7602232aa53))
- Add parser as a property on the Renderer object ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291))
- Send block text tokens to the text renderer ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291))

##### Features

- Send token objects to renderers ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291)) ([1ce59ea](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/1ce59ea827272b5d067f1e06d3ee4a1d52b1d9bb))
- Add space renderer that returns empty string by default ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291))
- Add header and align properties to TableCell token ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291))
- Add TableRow token ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291))
- Add Checkbox token ([#​3291](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/3291))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

- Add space token after blockquote and hr if there are multiple newlines
- Send token objects to renderers and move logic to parse tokens from the parser to the renderers.
  - Most extensions that update marked renderers should still work with this version but will break in a future major version.
  - Extensions that change marked renderers will need to be updated and use new option `useNewRenderer` and accept a token object instead of multiple parameters. See updated [Renderer docs](https://marked.js.org/using_pro#renderer)

    ```js
    // v12 renderer extension

    const extension = {
      renderer: {
        heading(text, level) {
          // increase level by 1
          return `<h${level + 1}>${text}</h${level + 1}>`;
        }
      }
    };

    marked.use(extension);
    ```

    ```js
    // v13 renderer extension

    const extension = {
      useNewRenderer: true,
      renderer: {
        heading(token) {
          // increase depth by 1
          const text = this.parser.parseInline(token.tokens);
          const level = token.depth;
          return `<h${level + 1}>${text}</h${level + 1}>`;
        }
      }
    };

    marked.use(extension);
    ```

- add block param to html renderer ([#​2768](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/2768)) ([fa21b9f](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/fa21b9f60a25992c027bf2c2dc12e7baaa0b24bc))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

- Warnings will be logged to the console if these options are used including `headerIds`, `mangle`, and `langPrefix` which are on by default.
  These warnings can be turned off by default by using:
  ```js
  marked.use({
    mangle: false,
    headerIds: false,
  });
  ```
  If you need these options you can use the extensions listed below.
- deprecate options
  | Option | Replacement|
  |---------|---------------|
  | `highlight`, `langPrefix`, and `callback`| [marked-highlight](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked-highlight)|
  |`mangle`| [marked-mangle](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked-mangle)|
  |`baseUrl`| [marked-base-url](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked-base-url)|
  |`smartypants`| [marked-smartypants](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked-smartypants)|
  |`xhtml`| [marked-xhtml](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked-xhtml)|
  |`headerIds` and `headerPrefix`| [marked-gfm-heading-id](https://www.npmjs.com/package/marked-gfm-heading-id)|
- minimum supported node version v18

### [`v3.0.0`](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/releases/tag/v3.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/compare/v2.1.3...v3.0.0)

##### Bug Fixes

- Tokenizers lex their own child tokens ([#​2124](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/2124)) ([288f1cb](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/288f1cbe2f55881972c0f594ddb9910888986bee))
- Add module field to package.json ([#​2143](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/2143)) ([edc2e6d](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/edc2e6dc129364b127c8a41dc6a83dd88daffba4))
- Drop node 10 support ([#​2157](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/2157)) ([433b16f](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/433b16fa3ac8ddcaead519b7f4e284137f7fac03))
- Full Commonmark compliance for Lists ([#​2112](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/2112)) ([eb33d3b](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/eb33d3b3a9f735ee9bee251d26bf779880dc3114))
- Refactor table tokens ([#​2166](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/issues/2166)) ([bc400ac](https://redirect.github.com/markedjs/marked/commit/bc400ac789c76e915df82b0998d3fd12c89da2e8))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

- Drop support for node 10.
- Add module field to package.json

***

- Tokenizers will create their own tokens with `this.lexer.inline(text, tokens)`. The `inline` function will queue the token creation until after all block tokens are created.
- Extensions tokenizer `this` object will include the `lexer` as a property. `this.inlineTokens` becomes `this.lexer.inline`.
- Extensions renderer `this` object will include the `parser` as a property. `this.parseInline` becomes `this.parser.parseInline`.
- `tag` and `inlineText` tokenizer function signatures have changed.

***

- `nptable` tokenizer is removed and merged with `table` tokenizer.
- `table` tokens `header` property changed to contain an array of objects for each header cell with `text` and `tokens` properties.
- `table` tokens `cells` property changed to `rows` and is an array of rows where each row contains an array of objects for each cell with `text` and `tokens` properties.

v2 `table` token:

```json
{
  "type": "table",
  "align": [null, null],
  "raw": "| a | b |\n|---|---|\n| 1 | 2 |\n",
  "header": ["a", "b"],
  "cells": [["1", "2"]],
  "tokens": {
    "header": [
      [{ "type": "text", "raw": "a", "text": "a" }],
      [{ "type": "text", "raw": "b", "text": "b" }]
    ],
    "cells": [[
      [{ "type": "text", "raw": "1", "text": "1" }],
      [{ "type": "text", "raw": "2", "text": "2" }]
    ]]
  }
}
```

v3 `table` token:

```json
{
  "type": "table",
  "align": [null, null],
  "raw": "| a | b |\n|---|---|\n| 1 | 2 |\n",
  "header": [
    {
      "text": "a",
      "tokens": [{ "type": "text", "raw": "a", "text": "a" }]
    },
    {
      "text": "b",
      "tokens": [{ "type": "text", "raw": "b", "text": "b" }]
    }
  ],
  "rows": [
    {
      "text": "1",
      "tokens": [{ "type": "text", "raw": "1", "text": "1" }]
    },
    {
      "text": "2",
      "tokens": [{ "type": "text", "raw": "2", "text": "2" }]
    }
  ]
}
```

</details>

### [`v20.0.0`](https://redirect.github.com/angular/components/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#2000-calcium-carrot-2025-05-28)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/angular/components/compare/20.0.0-rc.2...20.0.0)

#### Breaking Changes

##### cdk

- - `SelectionModel.clear` now returns a boolean.
  - `SelectionModel.deselect` now returns a boolean.
  - `SelectionModel.select` now returns a boolean.
  - `SelectionModel.setSelection` now returns a boolean.
  - `SelectionModel.toggle` now returns a boolean.
- - `DIALOG_SCROLL_STRATEGY_PROVIDER` has been removed.
  - `DIALOG_SCROLL_STRATEGY_PROVIDER_FACTORY` has been removed.
- - `DragDropRegistry` is no longer generic.
  - `DragDropRegistry.scroll` has been removed. Use the `scrolled` method instead.
- - `DomPortalHost` has been removed. Use `DomPortalOutlet` instead.
  - `PortalInjector` has been removed. Use `Injector.create` instead.
  - `PortalHost` has been removed. Use `PortalOutlet` instead.
  - `BasePortalHost` has been removed. Use `BasePortalOutlet` instead.
- - `Constructor` symbol has been removed.
  - `CanStickCtor` symbol has been removed.
  - `mixinHasStickyInput` has been removed. Implement the `CanStick` interface instead.
- - `CanStick` has been removed.
  - `CDK_TABLE_TEMPLATE` has been removed.
  - `StickyDirection` has been removed.
  - `StickyStyler` has been removed.

##### material

- - `ButtonVariant` which is returned by `MatButtonHarness.getVariant` no longer includes the appearance of the button. Use `MatButtonHarness.getAppearance` instead.
- `tabindex` values set as `[attr.tabindex]` set on a Material button might not work as expected. Use `tabindex` for static values, or `[tabindex]`/`[tabIndex]` for dynamic ones.
- - `MAT_CHECKBOX_REQUIRED_VALIDATOR` has been removed.
  - `MAT_CHECKBOX_VALUE_ACCESSOR` has been removed.
  - `MatCheckboxRequiredValidator` has been removed.
  - `_MatCheckboxRequiredValidatorModule` has been removed.
- - `MAT_DIALOG_SCROLL_STRATEGY_PROVIDER` has been removed.
  - `MAT_DIALOG_SCROLL_STRATEGY_PROVIDER_FACTORY` has been remov

</details>

Issues.Title: bug(@angular/material:theme-color): Typo in last question "Do you want to generated file to be a scss file?"
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I believe the correct sentence should be "Do you want **the** generated file to be a scss file?"

### Reproduction

Simply run `ng generate @angular/material:theme-color` and answer questions with any answer up to the last one.


### Expected Behavior

Last question should read:

âœ” Do you want the generated file to be a scss file? This is the recommended way of setting up theming in your application. If not, a CSS 
file will be generated with all the system variables defined. (Leave blank to generate a scss file)

### Actual Behavior

Last question currently reads:

âœ” Do you want to generated file to be a scss file? This is the recommended way of setting up theming in your application. If not, a CSS 
file will be generated with all the system variables defined. (Leave blank to generate a scss file)

### Environment

- Angular: 19.1.0
- CDK/Material: 19.2.18
- Browser(s): N/A
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): N/A

Issues.Title: build: update bazel dependencies
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [aspect_rules_js](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js) | http_archive | patch | `v2.3.7` -> `v2.3.8` |
| bazel_skylib | http_archive | digest | `454b259` -> `223e4e9` |
| rules_angular | git_repository | digest | `652e5b0` -> `88ddcf8` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_js (aspect_rules_js)</summary>

### [`v2.3.8`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/tag/v2.3.8)

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/compare/v2.3.7...v2.3.8)

Many companies are successfully building with rules\_js.
If you're getting value from the project, please let us know!
Just comment on our [Adoption Discussion](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/discussions/1000).

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_js", version = "2.3.8")

####### Node.js version #########

### By default you get the node version from DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION in @​rules_nodejs//nodejs:repositories.bzl
### Optionally you can pin a different node version:
bazel_dep(name = "rules_nodejs", version = "6.3.0")
node = use_extension("@​rules_nodejs//nodejs:extensions.bzl", "node", dev_dependency = True)
node.toolchain(node_version = "16.14.2")

#################################

npm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "npm", dev_dependency = True)

npm.npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

use_repo(npm, "npm")

pnpm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "pnpm")

### Allows developers to use the matching pnpm version, for example:
### bazel run -- @​pnpm --dir /home/runner/work/rules_js/rules_js install
use_repo(pnpm, "pnpm")
```

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_js",
    sha256 = "304c51726b727d53277dd28fcda1b8e43b7e46818530b8d6265e7be98d5e2b25",
    strip_prefix = "rules_js-2.3.8",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/download/v2.3.8/rules_js-v2.3.8.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()
```

#### What's Changed

- fix(publish): pick up secret when passed from caller workflow by [@​alexeagle](https://redirect.github.com/alexeagle) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2201](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2201)1
- refactor: create /ref and /pkg targets for local package store entries by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2191](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2191)1
- chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/publish-to-bcr action to v0.1.0 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2204](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2204)4
- fix: add live reload tag for ibazel by [@​Aghassi](https://redirect.github.com/Aghassi) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2205](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2205)5
- test: move pnpm\_lockfiles/cases to isolated test directories by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2208](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2208)8
- fix: pnpm v9 url version specifiers without resolved semver by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2209](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2209)9
- Changes by create-pull-request action by [@​github-actions](https://redirect.github.com/github-actions) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2203](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2203)3
- test: remove invalid pnpm lockfile test data by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2213](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2213)3
- Changes by create-pull-request action by [@​github-actions](https://redirect.github.com/github-actions) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2218](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2218)8
- chore(deps): update dependency aspect\_bazel\_lib to v2.16.0 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2214](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2214)4
- fix: correctly track treeartifact contents by [@​thesayyn](https://redirect.github.com/thesayyn) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2217](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2217)7
- test: separate optional + lifecycle lockfile test packages by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2207](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2207)7
- fix: add warnings for deprecated js\_run\_devserver,js\_run\_binary include\_types,npm\_sources attrs by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2225](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2225)5
- Changes by create-pull-request action by [@​github-actions](https://redirect.github.com/github-actions) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2227](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2227)7
- chore: fix bzl\_libraries by [@​alexeagle](https://redirect.github.com/alexeagle) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2232](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2232)2
- chore: format js\_run\_devserver.mjs by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2234](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2234)4
- chore: move docs back from aspect docsite. by [@​alexeagle](https://redirect.github.com/alexeagle) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2235](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2235)5
- fix: pnpm v9 lockfile git versions containing : by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2231](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2231)1
- chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/publish-to-bcr action to v0.2.1 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2233](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2233)3

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aspect-build/rules\_js/compare/v2.3.7...v2.3.8

</details>

Issues.Title: Fix null issue in url youtube url when running a playlist with no vidâ€¦
Issues.Body:
â€¦eoId

When playing a playlist via playerVars.list = [playlistId] we dont have a videoId available yet. Plus we don't need one, Youtube will start at the first video of the playlist by default.

By injecting an undefined videoId in the YT Player constructur, we end up with null value in the iframe url (`ps://www.youtube.com/embed/null?cc_load_policy=1&enablejsapi=1&controls=1&showinfo=0&rel=0&listType=playlist&list=PLxf07yK_HAvdwhW-L0X3uP5aMe6eEt50v`) which is causing an Invalid Video Id error for consumers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix null issue in url youtube url when running a playlist with no vidâ€¦" (#31403)

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/menu): Add backdrop support and maybe able to customize all overlay options in CDK Menu
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I think the [CDK Menu Trigger](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/cdk/menu/menu-trigger-base.ts) should provide an ability to set a backdrop in the overlay and also other `OverlayConfig` options.

### Use Case

This lets us create a custom Menu closer to the Mat Menu which already supports a transparent backdrop.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(cdk/menu): Add backdrop support and maybe able to customize all overlay options in CDK Menu" (#31399)

Issues.Title: Timepicker Input Flag Open Picker or not
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

## Problem
When using the Angular Material Timepicker, the picker dialog automatically opens whenever the associated input gains focus. This behavior is undesirable in certain applications, especially when the user only wants to manually open the picker (e.g., via an icon button or another dedicated action).

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0b18b29e-650d-4244-8cad-5bc2de3f5049)

##  Solve:
Create a custom directive that extends `MyMatTimepickerInput` and in its constructor calls the private method `_cleanupClick` to remove the default click handler.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/643dfde8-f2e5-4290-8b34-4d17aa549001)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b2739fa0-7838-4e04-8d86-7a434ad1887f)


### Use Case


## Use Case
- Forms where users might want to type a time value directly without the picker opening.
- Custom UI/UX designs where the picker should only open via a button.
- Accessibility: Avoid interfering with keyboard navigation or assistive technologies by preventing unexpected popups.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Timepicker Input Flag Open Picker or not" (#31398)
